quote: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

quote: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quote: Spend so much time on self improvement that you have no time to criticize others.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

quote: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you’ve launched too late.
author: Reid Hoffman

quote: Great companies are built on great products.
author: Elon Musk

quote: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

quote: The magic you are looking for is in the work you are avoiding.
author: Dipen Parmar

quote: Chase the vision, not the money; the money will end up following you.
author: Tony Hsieh

quote: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it’s not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

quote: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

quote: There’s no losing, only learning. There’s no failure only opportunities, and there’s no problem, only solutions.
author: Pitbull

quote: Move fast and break things. Unless you are breaking stuff, you are not moving fast enough.
author: Mark Zuckerberg

quote: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow will be our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: If you always do what you always did you’ll always get what you always got.
author: Jessie Potter

quote: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

quote: If you’re not a little bit uncomfortable on a daily basis, it means you’re not growing.
author: Sallie Krawcheck

quote: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

quote: If you are a friend to everybody, you are an enemy to yourself.
author: Mike Tyson

quote: Stay hungry, stay foolish.
author: Steve Jobs

quote: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett
